definitions.definition: a chemical element. Iron is a hard strong metal that is used to make steel and is also found in small quantities in blood and food.

examples.text: a hut with a **corrugated iron** roof
foods that are rich in iron
patients with **iron deficiency** *(= not enough iron in their blood)*
iron tablets *(= containing iron prepared as a medicine)*
She had a will of iron *(= it was very strong)*.

definitions.definition: a tool with a flat metal base that can be heated and used to make clothes smooth

examples.text: I just need to run an iron over my shirt, then I'm ready.
Use a cool iron on synthetics.

definitions.definition: a tool made of iron or another metal
chains or other heavy objects made of iron, attached to the arms and legs of prisoners, especially in the past
one of the set of clubs (= sticks for hitting the ball with) that have a metal head

examples.text: He hit a magnificent shot with a nine iron.

definitions.definition: to be involved in several activities or areas of business at the same time, hoping that at least one will be successful
to do exercises in which you lift heavy weights in order to make your muscles stronger
to control a person or a group of people very severely
to make use of an opportunity immediately

wordOrigin: Old English īren, īsen, īsern, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch ijzer and German Eisen, and probably ultimately from Celtic.
